dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/471505839 at Fri Mar 13 21:05:23 UTC 2020

panels.description:
_Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better._
  
### Component Thresholds  
_Satisfactory/Tolerable_  
 * puma: 1s/10s  
 * workhorse: 1s/10s
panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="web", stage="$stage"} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="web", stage="$stage"},
    0
  )
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="web", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="web", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="web", stage=~"|$stage", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="web", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: puma Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: puma Component Error Rates

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: puma Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: workhorse Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: workhorse Component Error Rates

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: workhorse Component RPS - Requests per Second
Estimated p95 puma Latency - per fqdn
Estimated p95 puma Latency - per method

targets.expr:
histogram_quantile(
  0.950000,
  sum by (le) (
    rate(gitlab_workhorse_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job="gitlab-workhorse-web", route!="^/([^/]+/){1,}[^/]+/uploads\\z", route!="^/-/health$", route!="^/-/(readiness|liveness)$"
, environment="$environment", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])
  )
)

histogram_quantile(
  0.950000,
  sum by (fqdn, le) (
    rate(gitlab_workhorse_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job="gitlab-workhorse-web", route!="^/([^/]+/){1,}[^/]+/uploads\\z", route!="^/-/health$", route!="^/-/(readiness|liveness)$"
, environment="$environment", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])
  )
)

panels.title: Estimated p95 workhorse Latency - per fqdn

targets.expr:
histogram_quantile(
  0.950000,
  sum by (route, le) (
    rate(gitlab_workhorse_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{job="gitlab-workhorse-web", route!="^/([^/]+/){1,}[^/]+/uploads\\z", route!="^/-/health$", route!="^/-/(readiness|liveness)$"
, environment="$environment", stage="$stage"}[$__interval])
  )
)

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Puma worker saturation per node.

Each concurrent HTTP request being handled in the application needs a dedicated puma worker. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    sum by(fqdn) (avg_over_time(puma_active_connections{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}[$__interval]))
/
sum by(fqdn) (puma_max_threads{pid="puma_master", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"})

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_puma_workers component saturation: Puma Worker Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Unicorn worker saturation per node.

Each concurrent HTTP request being handled in the application needs a dedicated unicorn worker. When this resource is saturated,
we will see unicorn queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Unicorn saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Unicorn saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    sum(avg_over_time(unicorn_active_connections{job=~"gitlab-(rails|unicorn)", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)
/
sum(max(unicorn_workers{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}) without (pid)) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_unicorn_workers component saturation: Unicorn Worker Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Unicorn worker saturation per node.

Each concurrent HTTP request being handled in the application needs a dedicated unicorn worker. When this resource is saturated,
we will see unicorn queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Unicorn saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Unicorn saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    sum(avg_over_time(unicorn_active_connections{job=~"gitlab-(rails|unicorn)", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)
/
sum(max(unicorn_workers{environment="$environment", stage="$stage", type="web"}) without (pid)) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: workers component saturation: Unicorn Worker Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Saturation per Node

panels.description: The number of unicorn workers actively processing a request. Lower is better. Outliers may indicate a problem with a single node in the fleet.

panels.description: The number of http requests actively waiting for an available unicorn. Zero is good, anything higher means clients are waiting.
panels.title: Queued Unicorn Requests for Service

panels.description: The number of http requests actively waiting for an available unicorn. Zero is good, anything higher means clients are waiting. Outliers may indicate a problem with a single node in the fleet.
panels.title: Queued Unicorn Requests per Node

panels.description: The number of unicorn processes terminated after 60s timeout. Lower is better.
panels.title: Unicorn Kills for Service

panels.description: The number of unicorn processes terminated after 60s timeout. Lower is better. Outliers may indicate a faulty node.

panels.description: The number of times this process restarted in a given period, including children workers. Restarts are associated with poor client experience, so lower is better.

panels.description:
This graph shows the average number of secondary database connections
        per process. A value of zero indicates that the secondary replicas are unreachable.
panels.title: Database load balancer: average secondary connections per client

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="web",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

end
